display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 752px; height: 1px; padding-top: 0px; margin-left: 4px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center; max-height: 170px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.h1: Assigning the responsible party for a transfer
div.p: This function is designed correctly to assign the responsible party for a transfer: that is, the party against which the liquidity check and reservation should be made in a world which supports currency conversion, and hence where the explicit debit party may not be the responsible party. It is designed to work either with a POST /transfers request or with a POST /fxTransfers request; but it could be split into two, one for each request type. It returns the name of the responsible participant, or nothing if an error occurred.
